results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Beginning reading
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Showns an innovative method of teaching reading based on the Victorian Education Department’s booklet “Beginning reading”. Shows how to develop awareness of semantics, syntax and letter-sound relationships through shared linguistic and reading experiences, personalised writing and a positive attitude towards print.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O'Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O’Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Becoming a reader
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with various reading experts who indicate a positive approach to parents assisting their children in the reading process. Also shows the types of activities that may be applied by parents to encourage reading and writing.
